member.summary: Gets and sets the property AdsOnDeliveryRestrictions.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property AdTriggers.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.ManifestLayout
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ManifestLayout. Determines the position of some tags in the Media Presentation Description (MPD). When set to FULL, elements like SegmentTemplate and ContentProtection are included in each Representation. When set to COMPACT, duplicate elements are combined and presented at the AdaptationSet level.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.ManifestWindowSeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ManifestWindowSeconds. Time window (in seconds) contained in each manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.MinBufferTimeSeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MinBufferTimeSeconds. Minimum duration (in seconds) that a player will buffer media before starting the presentation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.MinUpdatePeriodSeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MinUpdatePeriodSeconds. Minimum duration (in seconds) between potential changes to the Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) Media Presentation Description (MPD).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.PeriodTriggers
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PeriodTriggers. A list of triggers that controls when the outgoing Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH)Media Presentation Description (MPD) will be partitioned into multiple periods. If empty, the content will notbe partitioned into more than one period. If the list contains "ADS", new periods will be created wherethe Channel source contains SCTE-35 ad markers.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.Profile
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Profile. The Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) profile type. When set to "HBBTV_1_5", HbbTV 1.5 compliant output is enabled.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.SegmentDurationSeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentDurationSeconds. Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will berounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.SegmentTemplateFormat
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentTemplateFormat. Determines the type of SegmentTemplate included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD). When set to NUMBER_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs. When set to TIME_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Time$ media URLs. When set to NUMBER_WITH_DURATION, only a duration is included in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.StreamSelection
member.summary: Gets and sets the property StreamSelection.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.SuggestedPresentationDelaySeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SuggestedPresentationDelaySeconds. Duration (in seconds) to delay live content before presentation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.UtcTiming
member.summary: Gets and sets the property UtcTiming. Determines the type of UTCTiming included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD)

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.DashPackage.UtcTimingUri
member.summary: Gets and sets the property UtcTimingUri. Specifies the value attribute of the UTCTiming field when utcTiming is set to HTTP-ISO or HTTP-HEAD

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.EncryptionContractConfiguration
member.summary: Use encryptionContractConfiguration to configure one or more content encryption keys for your endpoints that use SPEKE 2.0. The encryption contract defines which content keys are used to encrypt the audio and video tracks in your stream. To configure the encryption contract, specify which audio and video encryption presets to use.Note the following considerations when using encryptionContractConfiguration:encryptionContractConfiguration can be used for DASH or CMAF endpoints that use SPEKE 2.0. SPEKE 2.0 relies on the CPIX 2.3 specification.You must disable key rotation for this endpoint by setting keyRotationIntervalSeconds to 0.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.HlsManifest
member.summary: A HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.HlsManifest.AdMarkers
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AdMarkers. This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint."NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output."PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 admarkers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest."SCTE35_ENHANCED" generates ad markers and blackout tags based on SCTE-35messages in the input source."DATERANGE" inserts EXT-X-DATERANGE tags to signal ad and program transition events in HLS and CMAF manifests. For this option, you must set a programDateTimeIntervalSeconds value that is greater than 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.HlsManifest.Id
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Id. The ID of the manifest. The ID must be unique within the OriginEndpoint and it cannot be changed after it is created.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.HlsManifest.IncludeIframeOnlyStream
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IncludeIframeOnlyStream. When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.HlsManifest.ManifestName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ManifestName. An optional short string appended to the end of the OriginEndpoint URL. If not specified, defaults to the manifestName for the OriginEndpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.HlsManifest.PlaylistType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PlaylistType. The HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) playlist type.When either "EVENT" or "VOD" is specified, a corresponding EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPEentry will be included in the media playlist.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.HlsManifest.PlaylistWindowSeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PlaylistWindowSeconds. Time window (in seconds) contained in each parent manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.HlsManifest.ProgramDateTimeIntervalSeconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ProgramDateTimeIntervalSeconds. The interval (in seconds) between each EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME taginserted into manifests. Additionally, when an interval is specifiedID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated every 5 seconds using theingest time of the content.If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, thenno EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and noID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespectiveof this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input,it will be passed through to HLS output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaPackage.Model.HlsManifest.Url
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Url. The URL of the packaged OriginEndpoint for consumption.

member.name: M:Amazon.MediaPackage.AmazonMediaPackageClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMediaPackageClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
